questions.question: She attended the party, …………………?
questions.description: Add a negative tag after an affirmative statement.

questions.question: The horse drew the carriage. Change into passive.
questions.description: In the simple past, the passive forms are made with 'was/were + past participle form of the verb'.
answers: The carriage is drawn by the horse
The carriage was drawn by the horse.

questions.question: Sam asked us, ‘Are you leaving today?’ Change into indirect speech
questions.description: We use whether or if to report questions.
answers: Sam asked us were we leaving that day.
Sam asked us whether we are leaving that day.
Sam asked us whether we were leaving that day.

questions.question: I feel happy whenever she ………………… at me.
I will be happy if she ………………….. at me.
questions.description: In the first conditional, use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: The voice of the protestors …………………… 	quite loud.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun voice, so write is.

questions.question: What is the plural form of runner up?
I realized that I ………………….. a mistake.
questions.description: Use the past perfect to indicate that something had happened before another action or situation commenced.

questions.question: Give the word that is opposite in meaning to 'moist'.
The children sat …………………….. the ground.
questions.description: To indicate position on the surface, use on.
